name: Achillea
description: Achillea, commonly known as Yarrow, is a genus of more than 100 species of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae, native to Europe, Asia and North America.These aromatic and hardy perennials are widely known for their feathery, ferny and grey-green foliage and flattened flower clusters in variety of colors. They are popular as edging plants and in rock gardens, beds and borders.
meaning: The genus was named after the ancient Greek hero Achilles. According to legend, Achilles used Yarrow to treat his and his soldier’s wounds during the Trojan War. The common name “Yarrow” generally refers to the Achillea millefolium, but may also be used for other species within the Achillea genus.
color_description: Yarrow comes in a wide range of colors including white, cream, yellow, purple, orange, pink and red.
